Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Anterior deltoid Lateral third of clavicle Deltoid tuberosity of humerus Axillary n.
C5 - C6		 GHJ: Flexion, IR, Adduction
Lateral deltoid Acromion Deltoid tuberosity of humerus Axillary n.
C5 - C6		 GHJ: Abduction
Posterior deltoid Scapular spine Deltoid tuberosity of humerus Axillary n.
C5 - C6		 GHJ: Extension, ER, Abduction
``` ::: ::: # Anterior head :::{layout-ncol="2"} ### Origin {#origin} Lateral 1/3 of clavicle @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Insertion Humerus (deltoid tuberosity) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Innervation {#innervation} [Axillary n. {{< var ref-axillary-nerve.roots >}}]({{< var ref-axillary-nerve.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Action {#action} Flexion, internal rotation, adduction @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: # Lateral part :::{layout-ncol="2"} ### Origin {#origin} Acromion @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Insertion Humerus (deltoid tuberosity) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Innervation {#innervation} [Axillary n. {{< var ref-axillary-nerve.roots >}}]({{< var ref-axillary-nerve.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Action {#action} Abduction @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: :::{.callout-note} *Between 60 and 90 degrees of abduction, the clavicular and spinal parts assist the acromial part with abduction @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: # Posterior part ### Origin {#origin} Scapular spine @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Insertion Humerus (deltoid tuberosity) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Innervation {#innervation} [Axillary n. {{< var ref-axillary-nerve.roots >}}]({{< var ref-axillary-nerve.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ### Action {#action} Extension, external rotation, adduction @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 :::{.callout-note} *Between 60 and 90 degrees of abduction, the clavicular and spinal parts assist the acromial part with abduction @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: # Clinical Relevance As the GHJ becomes more unstable, the deltoid muscle takes on more of a stabilizing role @kidoDynamicStabilizingFunction2003 # Strength Testing # Palpation # Dysfunction
